name: toted
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
tote
to carry something, especially something heavy or awkward: She usually toted the baby around in a backpack. The building was surrounded with bodyguards toting sub-machine guns. Gun-toting security men were posted at all the entrances. Synonyms
carry (TRANSPORT)
cart
drag (PULL)
ferry
lug informal
